db:abstract.db:para: The QAxSelect class provides a selection dialog for registered COM components.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QAxSelect dialog can be used to provide users with a way to browse the registered COM components of the system and select one. It also provides a combo box for selecting desired sandboxing level. The CLSID of the selected component can then be used in the application to e.g. initialize a QAxWidget:

db:section.db:title: enum QAxSelect::SandboxingLevel
db:section.db:para: The SandboxingLevel enumeration defines the desired level of ActiveX sandboxing.

db:td.db:para: Run ActiveX control in a separate process
Run ActiveX control in a separate low-integrity process
[since 6.5] Run ActiveX control in a separate AppContainer-isolated process

db:section.db:para: Sandboxing requires that the ActiveX is either built as an EXE, or as a DLL with AppID "DllSurrogate" enabled.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QAxSelect::QAxSelect(QWidget *parent = nullptr, Qt::WindowFlags flags = Qt::WindowFlags())
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QAxSelect object. Dialog parent widget and window flags can be optionally specified with parent and flags parameters, respectively.

db:section.db:title: QString QAxSelect::clsid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the CLSID of the selected COM component.

db:section.db:title: QAxSelect::SandboxingLevel QAxSelect::sandboxingLevel() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the desired level of sandboxing for the ActiveX control.
